intro: Cracca minor, commonly known as lesser cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and woodland edges. Cracca minor is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
